citation.article-title: Rubidibacter lacunae gen. nov., sp. nov., a unicellular, phycoerythrin-containing cyanobacterium isolated from seawater of Chuuk lagoon, Micronesia.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Rubidibacter lacunae sp. nov.
Rubidibacter lacunae (la.cu′nae. L. gen. n. lacunae a pool of water, of a pond).
Exhibits the following properties in addition to those given in the genus description.
Cells are 0.9–1.5 μm wide and 2.5–4.7 μm long.
Growth occurs at 25–35 °C (optimum, 30 °C) and in concentrations of sea salts of 2–7 % (w/v).
Utilizes ammonia, nitrate and urea as a sole nitrogen source. In vivo absorption spectrum shows peaks at 548, 628 and 679 nm and a shoulder at 565 nm.
The G+C content of the genomic DNA of the type strain is 60.5 mol%.
The type strain, KORDI 51-2T (=KCTC 40015T=UTEX L2944T), was isolated from seawater of Chuuk lagoon, Micronesia.
